subs.text: John Palfrey was executive director of Berkman when I was there in 2003. When we were starting to plan the first BloggerCon, he took me on a tour of the campus looking at places we could use. It was incredibly generous of him to do this.

When I was looking for information about podcasting, I came across a tiny picture of JP in the margin of a post about BloggerCon, on the archive for 9/29/2004, clicked the link and it's gone. Apparently it wasn't part of the archive that Automattic is hosting. That's too bad because there were a lot of "firsts" at the top level of the site, but it may have gotten lost when the site was converted from "Manila" to WordPress quite a few years ago. But they were able to find a snapshot of the page on archive.org (I had looked but came up empty) and there is this amazing picture of Palfrey that I had been looking for and never found, and now it is found once again.
I like this picture because it's very much what I like about JP. He's modest, which ironically stands out in a world of people who aren't. :smile:

PS: I chose Pound Hall because they had lots of relatively small rooms, instead of other venues with one large space. I wanted room for us to spread out and cover lots of ground in rooms where people might feel more comfortable contributing. It worked, Pound Hall was perfect as a real-world blogosphere.
